newsitem.title: CHINA: YUAN ENDS SLIGHTLY LOWER VS DOLLAR IN SHANGHAI.
newsitem.headline: YUAN ENDS SLIGHTLY LOWER VS DOLLAR IN SHANGHAI.

text.p: The Chinese yuan closed lower at 8.2896 against the U.S. dollar on Wednesday on a technical correction after hitting a 27-month high close of 8.2885 on Tuesday, traders said.
The correction had been expected because the yuan's rise to its 27-month high on Tuesday was based on speculative buying, dealers said.
"The yuan's rise on Tuesday was due to a few speculative deals and was not solid," one trader said.
"It did not reflect a change in market fundamentals and a technical correction today was expected," he said.
Trading was less active on Wednesday compared with Tuesday with most business done at 8.2896, traders said.
Dealers said pro-yuan sentiment was strong despite the fall on Wednesday with bankers expecting strong foreign trade data for July to be announced by Beijing in mid-August.
"Expectations of a large trade suplus will continue to support the yuan at its high levels," a second dealer said.
Dealers said they expected the yuan to move just above the 8.2900 level on Thursday.
The yuan opened sharply lower at an intraday low of 8.2951 and rose quickly to move in a narrow range of 8.2895 and 8.2899 for most of the session, hitting a high of 8.2889.
The weighted average price on Tuesday was 8.2891.
The yuan closed up at 7.1000 from 7.1310 against 100 Japanese yen and lower at an intraday low of 1.0720 from 1.0697 against the Hong Kong dollar.
